intro: Zephyranthes jujuyensis, commonly known as the Jujuy bellflower, is a bulbous plant native to the high Andes of Argentina. It produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, typically blooming in the spring. The plant is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and has a short growing season. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Zephyranthes jujuyensis is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes many bulbous flowering plants.
